intro: Pseudognaphalium austrotexanum, commonly known as Texas everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces numerous small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to reddish in color, arranged in dense clusters. It is known for its long-lasting blooms, which retain their color and form even when dried, making it popular in floral arrangements. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas.
